course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Discovering Civil and Environmental Engineering
course.description: A general overview of civil and environmental engineering, infrastructure development and engineering ethics is provided. The course includes both lectures and laboratory sessions, where the laboratory sessions are primarily directed to students who require the development of feasible conceptual solutions for the analysis and design of the basic problems in structural, geotechnical and environmental engineering. For first year engineering students under the four‐year degree curriculum only.

reviews.author: USTheagod
reviews.title: ez
reviews.comment_content: The course is divided into three parts, namely structural, environmental and geotechnical engineering. The content is really easy as it only gives a brief introduction to each sub-discipline.
reviews.comment_teaching: the structural and environmental engineering professors are quite funny but in the geotechnical part it's quite boring and sometimes i couldn't understand what the professor was saying because of his accent. Overall, I feel that they really have the heart to teach :)
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is excellent! As long as you memorize the lecture notes well (rmb to memorize the height of some famous buildings like ICC and length of some bridges like tsingma bridge) and get high score in the assignments and lab reports (if you have source it should be very easy), you may get an A easily lol

Lab report: 24% (3 in total)
Assignment: 24% (6 in total)
Final: 52% (80mc only, 2hours)
I almost got full marks in lab report and assignments and memorized some numbers just before the final and at last I got A+ so I guess the the A-range is very broad xd
reviews.comment_workload: workload is fair as you just need to do assignments (3-4qs and it's very easy) every 2 weeks and you have to do a lab report(quite difficult if you don't have source) every month.

reviews.author: kk32
reviews.title: 咁靚grade得唔得架
reviews.comment_content:
分左3part,每part由唔同嘅professor教.有structural, environmental, geotechnical而當中geotechnical engineering係最悶架.不過好彩每part只係教一個月,所以我都接受到
Lab就3揀2嘅,一定係揀structural同埋environmental,因為得geotechnical係自己獨自做report.大家都知點揀啦,記得早D去搶.
Lab係一個月一次,total兩次,不過一定要準時到,遲到既話實比groupmate放生你
上lab唔使太大壓力,其實好hea,只要跟足step同埋抄足data就夠
Lab report就唔好懶醒以為自己實識做,好多題目都係冇見過,lecture notes完全幫你唔到,乖乖地抄source啦
reviews.comment_teaching: 我冇認真過聽書所以我斷估佢哋差唔多掛
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade老實講真係幾靚,同埋今年因為要光復香港,所以cancel左final,直接出result
計分如下：
    Assignment x 6 (each 8.3%)
    Lab report x 2 (each 25%)
我Assignment平均95%
Lab report full mark
Final grade = A+
真係要講句多謝林鄭!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: 二個星期一份assignment,都係得3,4題,有時仲有MC,不過整體上黎講唔難,唔識嘅話lecture notes幫到你.老實講有D source係太舊或者根本得題目冇答案,所以冇咩事都唔好太依賴所謂既source.不過好彩佢D Source包埋report答案,只要識改少少字眼,你份report就唔難滿分

reviews.author: 準雷
reviews.title: Engine人必reg既靚grade course
reviews.comment_content:

reviews.author: m****6
reviews.comment_content: Quite boring tbh
reviews.comment_teaching:
LAM, Kit Ming
WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER MET IN UST!

There was a problem with the lecturer's audio that we cannot hear what he was saying for almost half of the lectures. We suggested multiple means for the him to solve this issue, such as putting on a earphone with mic instead of directly speaking to the computer. However, the lecturer REFUSED to take any of our suggestion, causing half the lecture being muted. It was not a isolated incident, but occurs in EVERY LECTURES! It was unacceptable that the lecturer even BLAMED US FOR THE PROBLEM! He said and I quote, "when I check the zoom recordings, the audio was fine". Ironically, he was then immediately muted for over half a minute.

Apart from the recurring audio problem, the lecturer is reluctant to share any information about the course's assessments. Students' request for answers for quizzes and assignments were refused by the lecturer. Requests for explanations regarding certain questions in the quizzes were DIRECTLY IGNORED by the instructor. The instructor was also unwilling to share information of our performances in quizzes, assignments and lab reports, making it very difficult for students to assess their performances.

LEUNG, Anthony
Can feel his passion for teaching. To be continued.

LO, Irene Man Chi
To be continued
reviews.comment_grading: To be continued
reviews.comment_workload:
Ok workload

2 assignments per session (6 in total)
Quizzes in class
1 lab report per session (3 in total)

NO MIDTERM, NO FINAL

reviews.author: Chleeba
reviews.comment_content: Basic things about structural, environmental and geotechnical engineering. Easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Kuang's lectures were quite interesting.
Professor Lo's and Professor Zhang's lecture were a bit boring to be honest, you will fall asleep easily during the seemingly infinite 2-hour lecture if you are not really interested in those topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework scores and lab report scores were averagely high (around 85-100 for mean).
No mid-term exam.
Exams were all multiple choice questions (120 questions, 40 for each session). Quite easy to answer if you read the powerpoints in detail.
Got A.
reviews.comment_workload:
One lecture a week.
One lab session a month.
2 homework and one lab report per session, which has to be handed in with hard copy, total 3 sessions (structural, environmental, geotechnical).

reviews.author: Felix
reviews.title: CIVIL 入門 Introduction Course
reviews.comment_content:
Civil 入門 Introduction Course
3 Area 各4 堂
由3 個唔同既 professor 教

1)Structural
       Civil Engineer 既角色同責任
       各類基建包括大廈、橋、隧道基本結構
       世界著明建築、嚴重工業意外
       入門 Structural Mechanic
              Support and Reactions, Moment, Truss Members
              難度同DSE physic level 相若
2)Environmental
       各類污染物既影響
       相對應既評估同改善方法
       可持續發展
3)Geo-technical
       地震、沙泥傾瀉既影響同預防方法
       各類沙石既形成
       土壤地質
       大廈地基結構

reviews.comment_grading:

Lab Reports: 24%

讀熟 ppt 就無問題
靚 Grade course

reviews.author: Handsomeguy1234
reviews.comment_content:
Briefly introduce the main topic in civil engineering: structural, environmental, geotechnical. Some of the content can be understood by common sense, you don't need to memorize all of the stuff. It also involved some calculations, but it would not very difficult if you follow the lecture notes. The final exam is closed book exam.

Personally, I think the geotechnical part is more difficult compared to the other parts.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Each part is taught by different professors.
The content is quite clear since each month will focuse on one part. The environmental part maybe hard for the students without studying chemistry to catch out. The lectures in this part haven't mention some of the content such as some chemical content in detail. But for other part, the content is explained clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is great.
Hw 1-4 full mark
hw 5: 2.16/4
hw 6: 3.5/4
lab report(structural): 7.88/8
lab report(geotechnical): 9.12/12
(!Don't choose geotechnical for lab report!!!)
Hw and lab report slightly below mean
The score of final exam hadn't release
Overall: A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, only 6 assignments and 2 lab report in whole semester.( 2 assignments per month in average).

reviews.author: SunnyKiki
reviews.title: A super good grade course (No Joke)
reviews.comment_content:
No mid-term,only exam.

The content to sum up is like this: 20%calculation and 80% content for memorising.All three engineering are like this.

Civil and Structural engineering:The content mainly talks about different kinds of buildings and bridges(e.g. the height of them ,different structure of building or  the famous buildings or architecture around the world)  Besides ,it also talks about the history of civil engineering and history about architecture from different old civilisation,say ancient China and Roma.

The calculation is simple force and motion ,it would be easy to understand if you studied physics in secondary school. (So you can spend more time to study other two engineerings)

Geotechnical engineering: The content is all related to rock and soil ,like earthquake or landslide etc. Or how to construct the fundamental structure of a building .This engineering will talk about many disaster events( Events from HK is important) .

You will understand what a geotechnical engineer does after listening to this engineering section.

This part of calculation need time to understand ,but once you understand ,you would be easy to deal with. It also related to physics.

Environmental engineering: This part is mainly related to CHEMISTRY. It teaches you how environmental engineer protect environment and the job detail in a construction(e.g. to test the ground soil whether it is suitable for construction) It also learns other things, like noise pollution ,air pollution and solid waste etc.

SOME calculations from this part are quite hard to understand BUT easy to do in exam. As in exam ,the calculation will only ask you the simplest version of those calculations. So if you don’t understand ,just try to memorise them.


The reason why giving C to content is because I hate memorising.
reviews.comment_teaching: In my opinion ,three professors are quite good at teaching. For environmental and geotechnical ,two professors do their best jobs to let us understand the content .For structural ,some people may find it boring and not easy to understand ,but for me it’s acceptable and not bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
The Grading is GOOD.

For my assignments, Only one assignment which is from geotechnical is not full mark, and it is way far below the mean(mean around 3.1 ,I get 2.2 out of 4) Since I forgot to handin before 6pm at the submission day. And I want to say that the geotechnical engineering professor is so nice ,it is because late submission is unacceptable but the professor has accepted my apology and allowed me to resubmit it WITH 20% mark reduction. Only the geotechnical engineering assignment was required to handin at 6pm while other two are before 12am ,so REMEMBER to handin geotechnical one on time!!!

For my lab ,one of the lab is full mark and one is at lower quartile.

For exam ,to be honest ,Since geotechnical engineering part is quite challenge for me and of course there are also some questions from the other two parts I don’t know how to do . So I am pessimistic for my final grade . However ,the final grade is A ,far higher then my expectation(expect around B or highest is B+)

The only suggestion here for you is to study at least one weeks before the exam as it has many things to memorise.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable . Every week has one homework which takes about 30 minutes to 1 hour. Also, there would be two lab reports you need to do based on your choices(choose two from structural ,geo and environmental)

reviews.author: Kevin KAI
reviews.title: Super Good Grade Course
reviews.comment_content: Teach some basic concepts and basic calculation about CIVL. A good introduction course
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is just so so, a little bit boring, sometimes just repeat the ppt things
The first instructor who taught Structural Engineering leave me a good impression. He is quite interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade is super good.
It is about your lab report + assignment + final exam
Lab report (20%), you only need to attend two session in this semester. The instructors will give you a super clear instruction and lead you to complete your lab. After that, you and your group mates should cooperate to finish a lab report. Most of the questions could refer to the source. The teammates I meet are all excellent. We all book a time after the lab session and finish it together with our handwriting and our thinking. Only meet a bad free rider. But that's ok.
Assignment ( 6 * 4% = 24 %). Three topics and two assignments per topic. The assignment is not so difficult, and you can also refer to the source.
Final Exam ( 56% ). If you want to get a good mark, please take time to remember all the things in ppt. REMEMBER: ALL THE THINGS IN PPT. Don't miss any corner. It really takes time. So please fighting. I spend more than 1 week to take notes and remember the knowledge.
There are not a wide gap in assignment and lab session. Actually I didn't do well in some of my assignment. So the grade greatly depends on the final exam. But fortunately I get a A+. This course is really famous for its good grade. I believe it!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload: only 6 assignment, not so difficult. I spend 30 min to 1 hour to finish each assignment. It is ok lar.

The professor is proud of himself as a Civil Engineer. His teaching is good.
Part II: Environmental Engineering
She teaching is clear but boring. Never skip the lecture because some of the details are not mentioned in the powerpoint which will be examined in the final
Part III: Geotechnical Engineering
The lecture is boring but the professor is willing to help students.

reviews.comment_workload: No midterm, only lab reports and final exam. The course is easy to handle, especially for year 2 Civil Engineering students.

Each of the topics has 4 lessons. And the course has a total of 13 lessons in three months. So each area will be taught for about 1 month.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Each area will be taught by a different lecturer and Anthony is the best.

The other two are not that good but still acceptable
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment and lab reports weighting are both 24%, and the rest are all final exams: 52%. No Midterm.

I got around 95% marks on the assignment and lab report. But I didn't receive my mark on the final exam. And overall I got A-.
reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.title: Surprisingly good
reviews.comment_content:

Civil engineering

Geotechnical engineering
reviews.comment_teaching:
All professors in this course are good presenters with fluent and clear spoken English.
The teaching is quite good. Professors tend to show a lot of Engineering examples and cases which help to picture the engineering concepts.
Personally, I am particularly impressed by professor Anthony LEUNG, probably because his experiment demonstration and interactive QNA session during the lecture.

However, the 3 hours lecture is somehow challenging for students to stay focused all the time. And, somehow the professor will put the most important parts at the end. (the last few pages of the PowerPoint slides)
reviews.comment_grading:
This is a good grade course.
The curve is extremely crazy, I got 72/74 in the last report which result in a low in the curve.  Fortunately, almost full marks in other reports and assignment
The final grade mostly depends on your final exam result.
The final exam result has not been released, but I think I didn't correctly finish the calculation for my answer, still received an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
The course contains mostly concepts and "stories" of engineering, with a small proportion of calculations which require fundamental science and mathematics. If you have studied physics and chemistry before, it will be easy for you to deal with the problems. Yet, if your target is A range, you may spend more time focusing on details to avoid careless mistakes.
Stay awake, do your assignment and report, memorize the details. (Ways to get good grade)

reviews.author: Yuyi
reviews.title: 輕鬆A range
reviews.comment_content:
Engineering
- Applying scientific knowledge, mathematics, and ingenuity to develop solutions for practical and technical problems.
Civil Engineering
- Deals with planning, design, construction and maintenance of physical and naturally built environment.
- The oldest engineering discipline after military engineering:
Public sector: municipal through to national governments, 市政府to 國家政府 Private sector: individual homeowners through to international companies
Importance of Civil Engineering
- Builds fundamental components forming a city:
<Buildings, bridges, water system, transportation and power plants>
- Improves working efficiency, productivity and living environment of society
Challenges:
- Must have clear understanding:
1. Theoretical backgrounds:
<Structural analysis, mechanics of materials, soil and fluid mechanics,
environmental protection, transportation planning...>
2. Technical issues:
<codes of practice, design materials and handbooks... >
3. Non-technical issues:
<Budget available, social, economic and political issues>
<Construction management, quality control and workmanship (note: essential factors that ensure the structures can work smoothly within their expected structural life)>
Note: possible consequences for poor construction management:
Poor quality control and workmanship -> high maintenance cost
Structural failure -> loss of lives
- Needs to design and build structures with complex shapes, long-span structures
and underground structures.

reviews.author: Hahahin
reviews.title: Only for online lessons (may not be suitable for f2f)
reviews.comment_content:
There are three parts in this course:
1. Structural Eng - Prof LAM
2. Geotechnical Eng - Prof LEUNG
3. Environmental Eng - Prof LO

The first part consists of more physics stuff (forces, moment) while the other two parts have basic mathematics only (just refer to the notes).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof LAM is not that good at teaching online. Most of his lessons had technical problems (laggy, difficult to hear). Worse still, he did not improve them and continued with the lessons.

Prof LEUNG seems to be the best among the three. He was willing to answer our questions. He also tried to teach us as many things as he could. So, we found his classes enjoyable.

Prof LO is not bad but not good. Her lessons were just mediocre, nothing special. I only remember that she kept telling us to open cameras and call our names. But she was the one that could end the lessons early.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to online lessons, the grading is different from the one during f2f (eg. no exams).

1. assignments (18%)
each part has two homework

2. lab reports (48%)
one for each part
group report
4 in a group (groupmates randomly picked)

3. class quiz (34%) Quite a lot in %
after lesson quizzes
around 3-4 quizzes for each part
some parts count the highest 2 quiz scores for the final grade

Overall: in A range
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is okay.

You could consider having one HW every week, just one report at the end of the month. Although you have to submit them in one week, they are easy (no need to spend too much time). But you have to urge your groupmates to do the report if you don't want to be a deadline fighter.

reviews.author: Peterson
reviews.title: Really depends on instrucor
reviews.comment_content: A good introduction to civil engineering, but it's better if you have a background in physics, or else you will struggle with structural engineering.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Only Anthony Leung is good, he is very charismatic and really cares about the students' progress, he is very patient with students' questions and is very friendly.

Irene Lo and Lam Kit Ming are terrible, especially Lam. Lam's lectures always had a problem with his audio but ignored the students' complaints and feedback, saying that the 160 students at home all have the problem while his system is perfectly fine. And he is not helpful when it comes to answering questions. The same goes for Irene Lo, she is relatively better of the two but still is not a friendly lecturer, she uses a robotic tone when it comes to speaking.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading curve is very high, basically can copy from sources and get full marks in all assignments, quizzes, and labs. But the answers are relatively simple and easy to find as long as you pay attention to the lecture notes.
reviews.comment_workload: Very few workloads, just a quiz every lecture,6 homework, and 3 labs for the entire term. The homework assignments and labs are easy and takes a short time to complete.

reviews.author: Mango Pudding
reviews.title: Surface-level intro to civil engineering major
reviews.comment_content:
Covers the three major aspects of civil engineering:
- Civil and structural engineering
- Geotechnical engineering
- Environmental engineering
Each has about 4 lectures

Basically, the surface-level content of the civil engineering major for one to decide if to further pursue this major.

Notable topics (which include most of the simple calculations in this course) are:
Statics, truss analysis, three-hinged arches, soil shear strength, slope stability analysis, municipal solid waste energy content, size of sedimentation tank, and chemical and biochemical oxygen demand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lam (Civil and structural part)
I recall that he was hard to hear over zoom and often had connection issues. Explained the physics concepts adequately enough and could help those without a physics background. Though he didn't explain the in-class quizzes despite being requested by several students.

Prof. Leung (Geotechnical part)
Could feel his enthusiasm for teaching this course, and conducting demonstrations despite those making a mess (getting water everywhere in the soil shear strength demo I think). He promptly responds to questions in the zoom chat as well even if it's out of the scope. Fantastic for providing extended knowledge.

Prof. Lo (Environmental part)
Loves asking questions and interacting with students.
reviews.comment_grading:
(Note: Special arrangement for the online semester)

Assignments 18% (6 in total)
Lab reports 48% (3 group submissions in total)
*Class quiz 34% (At the end of each lecture, a special arrangement for the online semester; would have been midterm and final exam for F2F)

From what I remember, the mean is pretty high for all three of the assessed areas.

In the end, I got A+, but for this term, I think it mostly comes down to the lab report scores, as my friend scored slightly lower in one or two lab reports and only got A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
6 assignments in total, approximately one per two lectures, and 3 group lab reports, one for each part of the course. All of them are due within one week of release.

= Assignments =
The assignments are quick and easy to complete, with straightforward calculations akin to those in the lecture slides. Beware of calculation errors though as the assignment means are very high.

= Lab reports =
(Note: Special arrangement for the online semester)
Lab reports take significantly more time and effort. For this online semester, we had pre-recorded videos replacing the hands-on lab. All experimental data were provided in the videos and would need to be copied to the report to perform calculations. The most time-consuming parts are the discussion questions which involve essay-like responses, which information requires online research and could not be found in any lecture slides.

Also, since the report is essentially a group project in which the teammates are assigned randomly, you need to pray for competent groupmates that pull their weight or bite the bullet and complete the majority of it alone.
(I had one groupmate that would just copy from CHero and the content would get flagged by MSWord's similarity checker, plus adding irrelevant answers not responding to the question. The rest of us had to scrap everything and redo it.)

= Class quizzes =
(Note: Special arrangement for the online semester)
Only assess contents taught in that same lecture, so not much prior preparation is required.

reviews.author: khimizi
reviews.comment_content: As an introductory course, the contents are pretty simple, only with basic calculations. For students who only want to have a glimpse of civil engineering, it is quite enough. But for real civil students, the contents are superficial.

reviews.comment_grading: Because the contents and assignments are so simple, if your make some mistakes accidentally, you will be in the B range. My recommendation is that if you are a careful student with great ability in looking into details, take it.
reviews.comment_workload: The assignments are easy but take time to complete. And the mean of each assignment is always above 90% of the score

reviews.author: Park
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
The course is structured in three parts: Structural, Environmental, and Geotechnical.

Structural engineering would be a simple course if you have a decent background in physics, especially about the force and free-body diagrams.

Environmental engineering is rather on a side of ethics, and sometimes calculation regarding pollutions.

Geotechnical engineering is more focused on materials, and foundation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Personally, I would consider the teaching of this course slightly lacking. If you are not used to the accent of the professors you may find difficulties in understanding the contents.

Besides, you could self-educate the entire contents using the ppts.
reviews.comment_grading:
This is a good grade course and I mean it.

You could easily get an A range when you are well prepared for the final exam (and by meaning well prepared is to memorize everything on the presentation)

The grade is based on:
- 6 assignments (2 for each engineering course)
- 2 Lab reports
- Final exam

I mostly got about or below averages in assignments, full marks for lab reports, and my final grade was A-.

Remember to memorize just EVERYTHING in the presentation. Even including the length of tallest buildings and bridges, or type of bridges.
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say this course has a slight but reasonable workload.

You have 2 assignments to finish in each engineering course which is consisted of a few questions (about 4-5).

And 2 lab reports which you can choose at beginning of a semester. Ideally, I would choose structural and environmental.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Kuang takes up the first part, Irene Lo takes up the second part and Anthony Leung takes up the last part of the course.

Kuang teaches lively in lessons. He always emphasizes on the red words which reminds you to pay extra attention to memorize it! No comments on the other two lecturers.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments (24%) (6 sets, 4% each)
Lab Reports (20%) (choose 2 out of 3, 10% each)
Final (56%) (80MC, the three parts are not mixed, clearly divided)
P.S. NO midterm

Assignment 1: 100/100
Assignment 2: 100/100
Assignment 3: 10/10
Assignment 4: 10/10
Assignment 5: 77/100
Assignment 6: 100/100

Lab 1 (Structural): 100/100
Lab 2 (Geotechnical): 48.5/50

Final: no statistics

Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say very light workload.

For this 2-hour course, I attended the first part of the course very often. From time to time I feel bored and found meaningless to attend the following lessons and I chose to skip the rest of them.

For assignments, not time-consuming and similar examples are shown in lecture notes. If you have sources, you find an easier way to master the assignments!

For lab sessions, please be reminded that you must attend the two chosen labs; otherwise you will get a Fail. I chose structural and geotechnical labs. Structural lab is a group project, you just have to complete some diagrams, simple calculations and explanations. Easy! Geotechnical lab is an individual lab, it mostly requires you to compare different tests and suggest solutions. If you have sources of labs, there is no big difference which you can just find the right answers easily.

For final exam, since this is a MC-based exam, you just have to revise all the content in the lecture notes. If you have time, find more information about geotechnical engineering. As mentioned, it is easy to kill the part about Structural Engineering as you only have to mention the bold, highlighted red words. As for other parts, you may easily find answers because the options are quite different. More to add is that you sometimes have to infer the answers when you come across the overwhelming words. Better not leave early, try your best to guess the answers by elimination. Take it easy and spend more time on revision before the final exam!!!

reviews.author: Natsuki_OwO
reviews.title: course with excellent grading
reviews.comment_content: The course included three parts, structural, environmental and geotechnical engineering.  They are only some brief intro and some simple  calculation will be teached if you have studied physic before, it is easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Kuang and Prof. Leung are quite funny and welcome students to ask them questions. Prof. Lo loves to give extra info that are not included in the lecture notes and these info will be included in finals as well, so you should not skip her lectures.

Labs are all well-prepared and i enjoyed them a lot. They facilitate my understanding of the topic. The TAs are all helpful and some of them will explain the theory behind by demostration if you have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is excellent!!!!!
Assinments: 6 in total, 2 per part
mainly calculations, but they are very easy if you pay attention in the lectures. Try to score higher marks, coz most people get full marks.

Lab report: 3 in total, 1 per part
Sources will help u but there will be some open-end question or some technical questions that required you to answer. Again, try to score higher marks, at least 95/100, some people could get full marks.

Final:
all mcq, easy job. Memorzie the lecture notes you could already a-, mainly focus on the features of well-known buildings and bridges, such as length, the reasons behind the fatal failures. CALCULATION IS NEEDED!!!! but they are easy if you have revised the assignments.

I got A+ in this course but I didnt get high marks in assignments and lab reports, so i think final determines your fate.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite light, 1 assignment per 2 weeks, 1 lab report per month. First 2 lab reports are group project and the last one in individual. Attendance is counted in all labs, absence will lead to fail in this course.

reviews.author: GUOSHANGFENG
reviews.comment_content:
this course is consisted of three part: structural, environmental and geotechnical.
structural and environmental part are really easy if you learn physics and chemistry in high school, just something about simple math calculation and free-body diagram. Geotechnical part may take you some time since there are a lot of things that you need to memorise.
reviews.comment_teaching: three professor are keen to teach in class and  they are glad to answer your question.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading is pretty good, I got almost full mark in three lab reports but just 70-80% in 2 of 6 homework. I still got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: it's quite low. no midterm and 85 MC questions in final exam

reviews.author: ettk
reviews.title: All in final!!
reviews.comment_content:
The course is a good intro to CIVL programs. It is basically sub-divided into 3 parts:
(1)Civil and Structural
(2)Environmental
(3)Geotechnical
Each part is delivered by a completely separated team of lecturer and TAs. Because it is an intro course, lots of factual content are covered and you are expected to memorize most of them. But never mind, if you are really interested and really do attend lectures, it will not be a difficult task to recall facts during your revision and final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
JS Kuang and Irene Lo are great professors in the department. They teach well in their expertise though they will only cover the very very basic things. But they are able to arouse my interest towards the specific field in civil engineering

Contrastingly, Zhang is one of the most boring lecturers I have ever met in my uni life, with the most monotonic voice and reading aloud his ppt all through his lectures. People are either sleeping or playing games during his lectures. But don't worry, even if you don't attend any of his lectures, you will still be able to answer all his final exam questions given you read through his notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
It would say it is rather lenient. You will be graded based on your lab reports, assignments and final exam. All people literally performed similarly in lab and assignment. That's why your focus should be the final exam. And the rumour was true: you have to memorize a lot of weird facts, like how tall is the tallest building in the world, how long is Tsing Ma Bridge.... It is hard to imagine that such questions would appear in a uni course exam, but they did.
So be prepared!
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments are given for each of the sub-section which I think is quite manageable. You can definitely finish each of them within an hour. Lab reports are more time consuming, but there are only 3 of them in total (1 for each sub-section). Get your teammates into a WhatsApp group before you leave the lab session :)

reviews.author: chpoonag
reviews.comment_content: Structural engineering, environmental engineering and geotechnical engineering are introduced during the course. There may be some calculation questions in the exam
reviews.comment_teaching: It is reminded that you had better attend Irene Lo's lectures since some of the contents may be taught verbally but not included in the lecture slides, and they may be tested.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 24%
Lab reports 24%
Final exam (All MC) 52%
NO MIDTERM EXAM!

Though data are not released, there were a lot of lab reports getting 9X/100, and a lot of 9-10/10 or 90-100/100 assignments.

Knowledge in the lab was tested, especially for those whose topics were taught by Irene Lo, and this kind of questions account for a significant part of the total score the exam paper.

History about structural engineering is not the main part of the course but was tested. For instance, you may be asked about how tall/long a building/bridge is.

There were calculation problems in the final exam. Some of them were pretty similar to those in the assignments. But for environmental engineering taught by Irene Lo, there were some calculation problems in which only changes of some variables were provided in the questions. They are more likely to be physics MC.

No cheat sheet was allowed. You have to remember everything in the final exam. So, be prepared earlier.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not high. In average, one lab each month, and each lab report is to be handed in within 1 week from the lab.

I remembered that there was once the deadline of the lab report was postponed since there were some holidays during the 1-week time after some of us had sent emails to the TA requesting for that.

reviews.author: zack0617
reviews.comment_content:
內容範疇主要分三部分︰CIVIL & STRUCTURAL既世界級建築，ENVIR既LAND, WASTE, WATER, NOISE, AIR POLLUTION，以及GEO有關岩土既PILE FOUNDATION, LANDSLIDE等等。

內容性質主要可分成factual information及calculation method，factual information例如青馬大橋既main span 係1377m, stonecutter island個sewage treatment system有五個過程等；Calculation方面就例如method of joint 去計member force, factor of safety就去睇個SLOPE安唔安全等。

考試前溫書，將內容分成上面兩類，再去記FACT同埋公式就唔會亂(雖然我個年有比到公式)。
reviews.comment_teaching:
每個部分都由一位Prof. 負責。CIVIL同GEO既教授接受程度高啲，學生唔影響到課堂進度既話都唔會管束，氣氛就較輕鬆。

每個Prof. 係唔同課題之間都有做到連接，課堂唔算太難跟，理解上既差異就在於連接段既長短同你聽唔聽得切。
reviews.comment_grading:
LAB:                  24%
(每個LAB佔8%)
ASSIGNMENT: 24%
(每PART 2份ASSIGNMENT，每份佔4%)
FINAL:               52%
(全MC，我個年兩個鐘做80條，唔出分直接出grade)

LAB: ~24, ASSIGNMENT: ~20, FINAL:冇出分，自覺大約錯2~3題
GRADE: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
成個SEM做三次LAB，六份ASSIGNMENT。

ASSIGNMENT冇SOURCE既話要自己跟番LECTURE POWER POINT做，我見人上堂兩個鐘都做得完。

三次LAB，頭兩次交GROUP REPORT，最尾個次就係INDIVIDUAL REPORT，有SOURCE既話滿分唔難。

reviews.author: Jacky 01
reviews.comment_content: 的內容都系civil的基本野，分為三個topic：Structural engineering, environmental engineering 同埋 geotechnical engineering。 大部分內容都系靠背，少量計數。Structural engineering會叫你背的世界著名建築，以及計truss， torque等physics mechanic野。environmental engineering會講香港有咩污染物同點樣處理的污染物。geotechnical engineering就會講香港的地址如何影響的建築，同埋地基既介紹。
reviews.comment_teaching: 有的悶，上堂都基本系講ppt，geotechnical engineering有時會有demostration同片睇。
reviews.comment_grading:
真心好grade，24%homework，24%lab，52%final exam。 homework有總共6份，每個topic兩份，有的同source唔同，但其實唔算難，可以自己做。lab就有3個，頭兩份系一組做一份report，第三份系自己做一份，幾乎個個都有九十幾分。而final exam系80題mc, 有兩個鐘時間，入面計數好少，大部分系靠背。不過佢有好多送分題，幾乎你有少少常識就答到。佢會問你青馬大橋有幾長，ICC有幾高呢的問題，佢四個選項的數值都相差好大，因此你只系需要背大概數值。我系考試前先背都背的切。final的分數唔會公佈，只會直接公佈個grade。
Assignment 1 100/100
Assignment 2 99/100
Assignment 3 10/10
Assignment 4 10/10
Assignment 5 3.2/4
Assignment 6 100/100
Lab report 1 95/100
Lab report 2 91/100
Lab report 3 50/50
Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: 冇mid-term，但功課差唔多系每個星期都有，不過功課一般都唔超過3題，唔算太麻煩。冇功課果幾個星期就要寫lab report，呢個就需要少少時間。

reviews.comment_teaching:
Kuang: Structural
Great professor who can make you love Civil Engineering. He is a really really great teachers.
Don't skip his class.

Lo: Environmental
Great professor who can make you aware of the environment. She teaches some details NOT in the powerpoint which will also be examined. She sets up some ground rules which really makes a better study atmosphere. Remember: Do NOT be LATE!

Zhang: Geotechnical

reviews.author: Rilakkuma

The course is divided into three parts, namely structural engineering, environmental engineering and geotechnical engineering, each taught by one professor.

1. Structural
      - History of civl engineering
      - Calculation of simple mechanics and force in each truss member
      - Accidents in civil engineering history
      - Introduction to marvellous civil engineering works around the world

2. Environmental
      - Land Decontamination and Solid Waste
      - Water Pollution
      - Noise and air pollution

3. Geotechnical
      - Structure of the Earth
      - Earthquakes, rock falls, and landslides

      - Land Reclamation

There will be calculations for environmental and geotechnical parts, but they simply require direct substitution of values into the formulae.

reviews.author: ae86ccs
reviews.title: It's a Easy Course. Easy Job. Very Easy. said by prof. Kuang.
reviews.comment_content:
This course is divided into three parts, structural engineering, environmental engineering and geotechnical engineering. Each part has 3 to 4 lecturers. In every lesson, you have to learn some facts and calculations. The first lesson of each part is the introduction of that part.
Structural engineering:
This part talks about engineering ethnic, how to calculate the magnitude of force in members of a truss, some ancient constructions including the pyramid... Of course, the Hong Kong's building is the concern of this part. Also, some failures in structural engineering are also mentioned.
Environmental engineering:
"Green...Green and Green!" said by prof. Kuang again! You learned 4 kinds of pollution. They are water pollution, air pollution, sound pollution and land pollution. Prof. Lo will tell you the source of the 4 pollutions and the solutions for each of them. For mathematic parts, you will learn how to calculate the sound level and questions related to the water plant.
Geotechnical engineering:
Earthquakes, solidification, rocks and landslides are mentioned in this part. This part is the most boring section I think. So, I vaguely remember this section.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teach by reading the powerpoints with explanations. It similar to the teaching style in High School.
Do not talk so much in front of Prof. Kuang and Prof. Lo as they will stop and warn you if you do so.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Good if you have sources.
All of my assignment: 8-10/10
Lab report, 100/100 + 97/100 + 95/100
Final: No idea as you can not get the paper back.

The test is not difficult. Some are common sense. It is necessary for you to remember some numbers and facts.

Overall, A+
reviews.comment_workload:
It is very LIGHT if you have sources and a cooperative groupmates.

For the final, I spent half a day to read the slides continuously for 1-2 weeks before the test because repetition is the key to remember.

reviews.author: Wai Ching
reviews.title: Good grade and detailed civil and environmental engineering course
reviews.comment_content:
Divided into 3 parts: Civil, Environmental and Structural

Civil discussed the definitions, history, standards, how to become a civil engineer and calculations with regard to structures.

Environmental discussed different types of pollution, related calculations and environmental engineering and management with calculations(Most complicated in exam).

Geotechnical discussed geology, structures' foundations, landslides and underground construction and reclamation.

All parts were detailed that you need to memorise the details for final examination.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lam had Chinese accent during teaching yet it was acceptable. Some may find his teaching boring as he did not use any means to grab our attention. Perhaps he did not care much whether we listened to him or not, even if the class was chatting loudly that almost covered his voice. Despite he still used everyday examples to illustrate the engineering concepts like pinned support was equivalent to a pencil case cover which could rotate only.

Prof. Lo did care whether we were concentrating in class so she often wanted us to remain silence when she was talking. Her performance was normal to good. The only downside was she did not mention some Chemistry background knowledge but we needed it for assignments and examinations. Therefore we need to find those knowledge on Internet beforehand.

Prof. Leung should be the best professor among three. Not only did he make hilarious jokes during classes, but also reminded us in his first lesson that no late submission was allowed, the due time of the assignments differed from the previous two (From 23:59 to 18:00 for the same day).
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments:24%(6 in total, 2 per part)
Lab reports:24%(choose 2 out of 3 parts) (group)
Final Exam:52%(80 MCs)

My grades: Assignment 1:4/4 (Mean:3.6/4)
Assignment 2:4/4(Mean:3.5/4)
Assignment 3:10/10(Mean 9.6/10)
Assignment 4:10/10(Mean 9.3/10)
Assignment 5:2.76/4(Mean 3.5/4)
Assignment 6:2.2/4(Mean 3.5/4)

Thank you for having sources which let me check answers before submitting for assignments 1-4 most questions. Also searching the chemical terms on Internet was necessary. This was significant for both environmental ones(3-4) as they involved some Chemistry: conversion of units.

Yet it was unfortunate that assignments 5-6 contained tricky questions that sources could not come into play. Therefore both of got got far below mean.

For laboratories, most of the questions were difficult that lecture notes could not help. Therefore paraphrasing the wordings of source or searching the Internet for authoritative sources like official/governmental organisations are recommended.

My grades: Structural:7.9/8 (group) (mean:7.84/8)
Environmental:74/74 (group) (mean:73/74)
Fortunately I did not have free riders in my groups!

Final exam contained 80 MCs. It would be a piece of cake for structural and geotechnical as they were all straightforward if you memorised the details well. Yet I was kinda surprised of environmental part that the calculation questions were confusing as they were not kinda mentioned in lecture notes, or required to be flexible. Overall they were in easy to normal difficulty.

Final exam did not provide scores

Final grade:A
reviews.comment_workload:
For assignments & lab reports, having sources would be an advantage but in late November my source link was disabled ......too bad. Even if you don't have sources, search those keywords that you can't understand into the internet.

For final examinations, study lecture notes as soon as possible because they were large in amount. Otherwise you may panic.

reviews.author: sidanmsw
reviews.comment_content:
3 major parts

1. structural
2. environmental
3. geotechnical

Part 1 involves basic physics and calculations. Background in physics would be preferred.
Part 2 involve simple chemistry ideas but it is easy to manage
Part 3 involve some geography knowledge. Even I didn't learn geography in high school it's still easy to figure out the key ideas
reviews.comment_teaching: All instructors acquire at least comprehensible accent in spoken English, there won't have much problem in understanding what they are saying in the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 18%
Lab reports: 48%
Class quiz: 34%

Grade: A+

The mean of assignment is really high and if you loss 0.5 marks, your assignment will be below mean. But it isn't a big matter if you are slightly below mean in assignments as they contribute relatively less toward the final grade.

Quizzes were made after lectures or during the lectures depending on different Prof. They would be extremely easy if you prep the lesson and listen well.

Lab reports are REALLY REALLY important and your score of it makes a lot of difference in your grade as other students acquire similar marks in asm and quizzes.

I am not looking forward to getting an A+ cuz there is still a big difference between me and the highest. However, I think this course offer more A range causes the grade released is unexpectedly good.
reviews.comment_workload:
there will be 3 lab reports, 5 assignments and 10 quizzes in total.

Quizzes were done in-class so i didn't consider them as workload.

Assignments can be done in 3 hours and there is a week for you to finish it. Sometimes you may need to google to find extra resources to know the answer of asm.

No mid-term and final is the best part of this course

reviews.author: 01michael
reviews.comment_content:
Structural: Lots of history!!! Need to memories them. Some simple secondary physics (force). Not much difficult things taught in this part.
Geo: Quite difficult in my opinion. As many new concepts are introduced.
Env: Talks about pollution. Not difficult. Some chemistry backgrounds would help.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lam(structural) is quite boring. His English is quite poor.
Prof. Leung(geo) is cool. He is a young and enthusiastic teacher. His delivery is quite on point.
Prof. Lo has the best delivery. She talks in a suitable speed and answer most questions well. Overall she is nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 24%; I got like about 90% marks
lab reports: 30%; two reports with full marks
class quiz: 24%; around 15/24 marks (only this sem includes class quiz)
final examination: 22%. I got 23/30 (mean 22.7)
I got a B+ which i expected to be higher :(
reviews.comment_workload: Two assignments per instructor. If you have source then it would be quite easy. You just simply copy the source and not much paraphrasing needed.

reviews.author: SQ Flyer
reviews.title: Just submitted assignments & labs & done since no final no memorization so good
reviews.comment_content:
The course content were similar to those in previous years. The only thing changed significantly was the professor for the structural part, Prof Kuang was retired and Prof Lam substituted his position.

4 weeks Civil and Structural Engineering
-Civil Engineering and Civil Engineers
-Civil Engineering in Hong Kong
-Basic Statics and Trusses with Method of Joints, three-hinge arch
-History of Civil Engineering and being a Civil Engineer

4 weeks Environmental Engineering
-Environmental Engineering
-Wastewater Pollution
-Noise Pollution
-Air Pollution
-Land Pollution

4 weeks Geotechnical Engineering
- Basic Geology
- Foundations of High Rise Buildings
- Landslides
- Underground Construction and Land Reclamation

Originally, we have to memorize all the details from the lecture notes to prepare for the final exam,asking silly questions like the length of the Tsing Ma Bridge, the height of ICC etc, but turned out no final exam this semester.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I never attended the weekly lectures so I can't judge the performance of the professors precisely. I think the three professors performed normally and causally since this is a very casual course for CIVL and Year 1 Engine students.

But I can tell Anthony should be the best among them since CIVL students attended his lectures in CIVL 2160 and he could explain stuffs clearly. Irene is supportive and experienced given she stayed in the department for almost 30 years.

I only attended the two compulsory lab sessions, the structural and environmental labs. The TAs would simply demonstrate the lab procedures and explained some of the concepts behind the labs. Just raised questions for any problems regarding the lab reports and processes and they were likely to answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the unprecedented and revolutionary social movement, the grading system has changed accordingly after class suspension. Prof Anthony decided to make an election for students to decide whether or not the final exam should continue to be conducted.

Finally, no final exam this semester. Only the assignments and lab reports were assessed.

Assignments x 6 50%
Labs x 2 50%

Didn't collect all the assignments after marking so failed to provide the concrete details of scores. Note that I didn't receive full mark for most of the assignments except the lab reports.

It should have little significance for the grading. I think most people received quite good grade this semester and being lazy is encouraged.

Final Grade: A

Turns out the grade ah, not bad, but personally speaking if the final exam was conducted, I think the grading would be more reasonable and might have chance to get a A+ fairly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very low workload for this simple course.

A total of 6 assignments bi-weekly. Each part consists of 2 assignments with some calculation problems, some questions can  directly refer to sources and the lecture notes.

2 lab reports
I selected the structural and environmental labs. The lab reports were done with a group of 4-5 students. You can make references from the sources or websites for answering the lab questions. Some calculations, graph plotting, assumptions and open-ended questions. Just try answering in detail and make good division of labor with the groupmates, then no big deal (you know what I mean)

Personally not recommend the geotechncial lab since it required individual work and the lab was conducted in November, the weeks that most students were working on LANG essays, presentations and revision. Furthermore, the score of geo lab is generally lower than the other two labs from previous experience.

reviews.author: vickyaang
reviews.title: good grades
reviews.comment_content:
split into three parts of contents
useful for an introductory course for civil engineering
reviews.comment_teaching:
the structural and environmental engineering professors are quite funny but in the geotechnical part it's quite boring and sometimes i couldn't understand what the professor was saying because of his accent. Overall, I feel that they really have the heart to teach :)

GRADING

grading is excellent! As long as you memorize the lecture notes well (rmb to memorize the height of some famous buildings like ICC and length of some bridges like tsingma bridge) and get high score in the assignments and lab reports (if you have source it should be very easy), you may get an A easily lolengineering

Lab report: 24% (3 in total)
Assignment: 24% (6 in total)
Final: 52% (80mc only, 2hours)
I almost got full marks in lab report and assignments and memorized some numbers just before the final and at last I got A+ so I guess the the A-range is very broad xd

WORKLOAD

- workload is fair
- assignments every 2 weeks
- do a lab report (quite difficult) every month.

reviews.author: SL
reviews.comment_content:
The course contains 12 lessons and 3 sessions:

1. Structural engineering
2. Environmental engineering
3. Geotechnical engineering

The ppts are easy and just a little complicated in the calculation of structural engineering part.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturers are ok that they explan clearly mostly.
However, the lectures are not nessary as the contents are ok for you to read by youselves if you just aim for the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is ok.
Lab must follow the model answer or else will deduct marks.
Moreover, you must complete all assignments and lab reports in order to get good grade.
Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
6 Calculation assignments, 3 Lab reports (It is ok for you to complete it if you have sources or have someone to ask)

No Midterm Exam
Have Final Exam (Just MC questions)

No attendence taken

reviews.author: Roy
reviews.title: 超好Grade的intro course
reviews.comment_content: 教的都是背書多，lecture可以走哂佢，但lab就唔走得一定要上
reviews.comment_teaching: 教得幾好，但朝早9點堂講地質既lecuture好易令人訓著
reviews.comment_grading: 好grade，做足功課上足lab，考之前溫一溫就得
reviews.comment_workload: 唔算大，可以接受，功課都好容易，而且同source題目差唔多，基本上可以照抄

reviews.author: MrEdward
reviews.title: 2014-15 Spring
reviews.comment_content:
Brief introduction to civil engineering
1)structural-simple maths and physics eg simple truss calculation
2)environmental-some more facts to know eg water treatment  
3)geotechical-also just some facts eg the formation of different rocks
The content is not difficult to understand because it is an introductory course,but also a good starting point for beginner.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Irene Lo is very friendly and kind to answer your questions.
For Prof Zhang , his pronunciation sometimes makes things unclear, but overall it is still acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grades.
A-range is an easy job if you have revised for the exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload except the lab reports.
Homework problems are easy. Just to be careful of the calculation.

reviews.author: Jason Sin
reviews.comment_content: The course is divided into 3 parts. It taught about the structure and principle of building structure, environmental problems caused by civil engineering and how to withstand the natural environment when building a structure.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Lam taught with high passion. He encourages students to open cam but not strictly required. He is nice but a little boring. If you have questions, you can just ask in coure and he is willing to answer it.
Prof Lo may look strict in first glance, but she is nice too. She explained the course content clearly and it is the easiest to understand. However, she required students to turn on cam.
Prof Leung taught interestingly and his lesson is refreshing. It has least things to remember througout the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is depending on the quiz in some of the lesson and 3 lab report (each part has 1)
reviews.comment_workload: Quiz is quite easy. However, for prof lam' s quiz, you need to revise well to remember the numbers of ome examples. It is okay for prof lo and prof leung because it doesn't need much memorize but need concentrate in class. Among 3 lab report, Prof lo one is the easiet to get high grade

reviews.author: 懲教處女職員
reviews.title: Source is King
reviews.comment_content:
分左3 Part, 都係d basic civil野同計少少數

1. Civil and Structural Engineering
開頭講下civil d background, 之後就開始講structural d野e.g. 計moment force果d
有讀過下physics呢part應該輕鬆渡過

2. Geotechnical Engineering
講下d石頭泥土咁, 又有講下點預防山泥傾瀉果d

3. Environment Engineering
講下唔同污染(solid waste, water pollution, noise, air pollution)
reviews.comment_teaching: 3 part都教得ok, 正正常常咁囉
reviews.comment_grading:
今個sem全online, 好似改左計法

1. Assignment 24%
6份Assignment, 有source基本上滿分, 無野好講

2. Lab Reports 30%
3揀2 一group人做, 我就揀左structural + environmental, 聽人講geo = 靚grade之選
都係果句, 有source = 9成分以上

3. Class Quiz 24%
每堂最尾都有個quiz, total 6個, 每個4%, 建議組隊

4. Final 22%
err... 溫下書背下野就得

今個sem我就overall 90%左右 拎A-, 有同伴一齊就相當輕鬆
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment每份1個鐘內就得
Lab Report就分工每人都係做幾條分題
Quiz, final果d就唔當係workload啦
只要final時溫一陣我諗B以上都無咩難度

reviews.title: Best prof ever!
reviews.comment_content:
1. Newton's Laws
2. Vector and its applications
3. Trusses
4. Internal force diagrams
5. 1st and 2nd Moments of area

Mostly he will not use ppts. And he will write on the white board. So sit in the front!!! or u may miss the content.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good! I got mean in midterm and I donnot know how is my final and got an A! Lambros is the best!!!
